item.title: Democratic theory of the case
item.description: Democrats are seizing on a line they think can beat Republicans: Law and order.
item.author: Darren Samuelsohn

item.title: Republican theory of the case
item.description: GOP activists say they'll stay on political high ground as the public absorbs the cuts.
item.author: Darren Samuelsohn

item.title: Young on 'wetbacks' comment: I 'meant no disrespect'
item.description: "I know that this term is not used in the same way nowadays," the Alaska Republican lawmaker says.
item.author: Katie Glueck

item.title: Cornyn slams Young's use of slur
item.description: "The comments used by Rep. Young do nothing to elevate our party," he says.
item.author: Ginger Gibson

item.title: Perry gang rides into the sunset
item.description: Texas politicos say it's largely unclear who would steer a reelection or White House campaign.
item.author: Alexander Burns

item.title: DNC amps up fundraising
item.description: Jordan Kaplan comes aboard as the new finance director of the committee.
item.author: Mike Allen

item.title: China, U.S. cyberwar escalates
item.description: The Michigan lawmaker's comments come as the U.S.-China cyberbattle escalates.
item.author: Tony Romm

item.title: Murkowski 'evolving' on gay marriage
item.description: "There is a change afoot in this country," she says.
item.author: Breanna Edwards

item.title: Paul hits Hollywood on gun control
item.description: He says some of those calling for gun control are benefiting from armed protection themselves.
item.author: Kevin Cirilli

item.title: S.A.: Mandela making progress
item.description: A statement says he is in good spirits.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Conservatives score tax victory
item.description: The Senate tells the Congressional Budget Office it should give more credit to the power of cuts.
item.author: Kelsey Snell,David Nather

item.title: Pols question Saudi 'trusted' status
item.description: Rep. Mike McCaul and colleagues say Homeland Security's new policy presents "potential risks."
item.author: Burgess Everett

item.title: Schwartz plans to run for Pa. gov
item.description: She joins a developing field of Democrats who believe they can beat Gov. Tom Corbett in 2014.
item.author: Jonathan Allen

item.title: Boehner praises recent GOP success
item.description: But the speaker doesn't outline a roadmap for what could be a rocky few months ahead.
item.author: Jake Sherman

item.title: Lanza, mom had NRA certificates
item.description: NBC says an NRA shooting guide was also found.
item.author: Katie Glueck

item.title: Esquire's fashion tips for Christie
item.description: The men's magazine's says he "could learn from that other rotund politician, William Howard Taft."
item.author: Patrick Gavin

item.title: Playbook: Obama alumni news
item.description: 16 members of the Obama 2012 team will join BSD.
item.author: Mike Allen

item.title: Barry apologizes for anti-NPS tweets
item.description: "The thrust of it was right, the thing that went too far was the MoFo," the D.C. council member says.
item.author: Breanna Edwards

item.title: Bostic hits Sanford on personal life
item.description: "A compromised candidate is not what we need," he tells the Republican crowd.
item.author: Alex Isenstadt

item.title: Hagel: 'Good news' on furloughs
item.description: The defense secretary announces the reduction of furlough days from the planned 22 days to 14.
item.author: Stephanie Gaskell

item.title: Obama to talk gun laws in Denver
item.description: He'll push for reform in background check system.
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Court rejects Gitmo trial challenges
item.description: The appeals court won't hear challenges from the media or ACLU over partial closure of the tribunals.
item.author: JOSH GERSTEIN

item.title: Obama's new 'trust me' offensive
item.description: Opinion: Obama has left a trail of broken hearts, reneging on commitments to major groups.
item.author: Keith Koffler

item.title: Cash-starved states eye pot tax
item.description: Some state legislators are seeing dollar signs in dime bags.
item.author: Rachael Bade

item.title: McConnell's scorched-earth strategy
item.description: A top target, the Senate Republican leader is planning to be "very aggressive."
item.author: Manu Raju

item.title: VIDEO: POLITICO Playback
item.description: The best of last night's late-night television.
item.author: MADELINE MARSHALL

item.title: Obama to release budget April 10
item.description: The White House attributes its two-month delay in part to a focus on sequestration.
item.author: JENNIFER EPSTEIN

item.title: W.H. 'deeply concerned' by attack
item.description: Josh Earnest says the White House has "noted the increased tempo in clashes in the Damascus area."
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Limbaugh: Gay marriage 'inevitable'
item.description: "This issue is lost," the conservative host says. "I don't care what the Supreme Court does."
item.author: DYLAN BYERS

item.title: Romney: Good to be 'normal' again
item.description: He isn't missing the campaign trail, but says he's worried about the future.
item.author: Kevin Cirilli

item.title: Plouffe lashes out at Gallup
item.description: The former top Obama adviser highlights poor predictions in last year's presidential election.
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Grassley writing own Senate gun bill
item.description: The move could complicate things for Democrats.
item.author: John Bresnahan,Manu Raju

item.title: North Korea orders rocket prep
item.description: The U.S. decision to send nuclear-capable B-2 bombers over its neighbor provokes response.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Roberts victim of credit-card fraud
item.description: Chief Justice tells the cashier at a Starbucks that he had to use cash, according to a report.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: The odd coincidences of 'Olympus'
item.description: The movie has foreshadowed to some degree three major news events.
item.author: Patrick Gavin

item.title: Reports: Barbara Walters to retire
item.description: The ABC News personality will retire in May 2014, according to several outlets.
item.author: MACKENZIE WEINGER

item.title: The Scrum: Judd, guns, gay marriage
item.description: In this week's episode of The Scrum podcast: Gay marriage at the Supreme Court and Ashley Judd's pass on the Kentucky senate race.
item.author: Alexander Trowbridge

item.title: Group files Gohmert ethics complaint
item.description: Earlier this month, the lawmaker got in a late-night verbal altercation with a police officer.
item.author: DAN BERMAN

item.title: Cantor: Immigration tough but doable
item.description: "We've got an opportunity to come together on one point, and that is the kids," says the Republican.
item.author: Jake Sherman

item.title: Giffords to give Bard commencement
item.description: The former congresswoman will also receive an "honorary doctorate of humane letters."
item.author: Kevin Cirilli

item.title: Poll: 43 percent back citizen path
item.description: The distinction between legal status and a path to citizenship proves critical.
item.author: Kevin Robillard

item.title: Meghan McCain gets a TV show
item.description: She describes the show as "Meet the Press" meets "Jackass."
item.author: CAITLIN MCDEVITT

item.title: Redford: Nixon gave me weird 'vibe'
item.description: The actor had a bad feeling about Nixon well before Watergate.
item.author: CAITLIN MCDEVITT

item.title: Matalin, PETA team up for 'ag gag' ad
item.description: The Republican consultant appears in an ad calling out cruelty in factory farms.
item.author: Patrick Gavin
